formattedAddress: 375 Pearl St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 375 Pearl St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

originalText.text: The place is really nice, but we were kicked out 3 hours earlier than what the website showed as business hours. I was in the middle of a very important call. I was not told the store was closing early that day. Did not even have time to finish my coffee

text.text: The place is really nice, but we were kicked out 3 hours earlier than what the website showed as business hours. I was in the middle of a very important call. I was not told the store was closing early that day. Did not even have time to finish my coffee

originalText.text: The short curly haired Chinese barista was very rude to me. I walked into the store after ordering from the app. I approached the pick up counter and stood there for about 2-3 minutes watching here serve every other customer but me. When she finally called my name, I proceeded to take my order like normal. Then, I hear her say to me in a harsh tone, “So you do know your name.” I was shocked and confused on why she had said this to me. She told me that they didn’t have owl cake pop and asked me if I wanted the chocolate, or cookies and cream one instead. I requested to see what they looked like and she replied with, “It’s literally just the chocolate cake pop and cookies and cream one.” This made me angry specifically because she said it so rudely. Shouldn’t the workers have some respect to their customers?? Anyway, I got the chocolate cake pop as the replacement. I watched her walk over to another barista and I hear her say “…like does she not know her name?” I instantly knew that she was talking about me and I felt extremely offended. She got my cake pop, walked back to the pick up counter, and slid the chocolate cake pop across the counter as she says “Here you go.” In the most emotionless way possible. This Starbucks needs to hire better baristas. Especially ones who are actually professional with their job. I will not be returning to this Starbucks.

originalText.text: I bought a $7 chicken sandwich. the minute I put it in my mouth, I  spilled it out. The bread was so dried to the point you don't want to swallow and the strong smell of syrup felt like it had been stored for a long time

text.text: I bought a $7 chicken sandwich. the minute I put it in my mouth, I  spilled it out. The bread was so dried to the point you don't want to swallow and the strong smell of syrup felt like it had been stored for a long time

originalText.text: It's ok I get the sense it's not as functional as other Starbucks in heavier trafficked  areas and it would be extremely helpful and professional if they put the hours they are open and closed in a search online, also I was in there one Saturday early morning and they were playing heavy metal, i had to stay because i was meeting  someone and I saw someone else commented about this also, I can understand if it was a mix of music genres including heavy metal but it was straight heavy metal early morning and the the whole morning i was there until i left , I guess one of the workers thinks they are at home or in a concert   but it's loud, disturbing and unprofessional and I couldn't hear the young lady that was taking my order.

originalText.text: I can't lie I loved it. This Starbucks is how it use to be back in the 2000's but with an up to date vibe. It is spacious and comfortable. Here you don't need to rush out. Too many Starbucks now is stand, drink and go. Or they have those really hard uncomfortable stools. Only thing missing here for me is the  biscotts in the glass jars and ceramic cups to stay of course.
